Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Riddle \Rid"dle\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Riddled}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Riddling}.] 1. To separate, as grain from the chaff, with a riddle; to pass through a riddle; as, riddle wheat; to riddle coal or gravel. [1913 Webster]
2. To perforate so as to make like a riddle; to make many holes in; as, a house riddled with shot. [1913 Webster]

riddled adj 1: (often followed by `with') damaged throughout by numerous perforations or holes; "a sweater riddled with moth holes"; "cliffs riddled with caves"; "the bullet-riddled target" 2: spread throughout; "cities riddled with corruption"
